messages.message: where can i find a mapping between release version (i.e. 20.2.0.0) <-> release branch (i.e. release-2020-08-10)? trying to debug a problem in FRB that they are on `20.1.3` ….
Following. I'm not sure I understand the question, but I'm interested in learning more. Are you asking what the diffs are between those versions?

so in engineering, we are used to refer to a release using the release branch (release-2020-08-10, or what most engineers called “the August release”). But our customers use release version which is in the format of year.major.minor.patch (20.2.0.0). I’m trying to figure out what release branch a customer is on given their release version. asking if we record a map between the two :slightly_smiling_face:

I use https://instabase.com/docs/releasenotes/ . Doesn't map to specific branch, but would map something like `20.1.3` to "April 2020", and then I would type `release-2020-04-` into github and let it autocomplete :stuck_out_tongue:

what @Erick said, the release notes have the month and the version, also in the release calendar sheet (hmmm, sheet is not maintained for most recent versions...) https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1nIYCxB1cg1nYA56aVnga_Z7DzlgJMscOs4oRTTwMXv0/edit#gid=0
it’ll also be in the jira fix versions now, as `date (release #)`
